# Linux system management



## package management

### apt & dpkg

#### list files

```
dpkg -L package         # an installed package, use `dpkg-query -L`
dpkg -c package-file    # a deb file,           use `dpkg-deb -c`
apt-file list -F pakage # an online package,    `-F` means `--fixed-string`
```

#### details


1. remove and reinstall would preserve some configuration file, such as `/etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg`, you can consider `apt purge`

#### deal with an urgent error

```bash
sudo dpkg --remove --force-all package
sudo apt upgrade -yf
```

### yum & rpm 

#### epel

the simplest way is `yum -y install epel-release`

you can also try to edit `/etc/yum.repos.d/epel.repo`

```
[epel]
name = epel packages
baseurl = https://mirrors.tuna.tsinghua.edu.cn/epel/7/x86_64/
gpgcheck = 0
enabled = 1
```

when you meet xz compression error: `sudo rm -rf /var/cache/yum/x86_64/6/epel/ # `
